full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/11/2023 CHAMA Cambridge American Assection INC 105 Windsor Street, Cambridge, Mass. 02139 Tel. (617) 482-6622 A non-posts organization tax stamp MMM No. 45383 Liberty equality fraternity Republic of Haiti Excerpted from the minutes of the Clerk of the District Court of Port au Prince East section. Today, Monday the first day of the month of October nineteen hundred eighty- BC four, Year 181 of Independance, at ten o'clock in the morning. of Before Us, Raoul Saint-Cyr, Judge of the District Court of the capital East section, with the assistance of Louis Edner Duverneau, clerk. Day Appeared citizen Rose Garcon (also) known as Idora Pierre-Paul, landowner living and domiciled at Port au Prince, identification no. . Who declared to us that her certificate has been lost and that all attempts to find it in the places designated by law for its keeping have proved vain and fruit- less; and that she currently needs her birth certificate in order to prove her identity according to her rights. In conformance to Articles 70-71 of the Civil Code, she has brought before the bench three witnesses who will testify under oath that she was born on December 1st 1905 of the union of husband Cersius Pierre-Paul and the woman Jeancilia Pierre, both deceased. There have appeared: Philippe Emmanuel i.d. no. 9090-V Gerard Louis i.d. no. 4343-B Fedner Louis i.d. no. 4343-K All landowners living and domiciled at Port au Prince, Haitiens of legal age, enjoying their full civil and political rights. After a reading by the clerk of the preceding exposition, they have declared, certified, and sworn that they are perfectly well acquainted with the woman named Rose Garcon (also) known as Idora Pierre-Paul and that they know more importantly that she was born at Quartier Morin on December 1st 1905 of the legitimate union of husband Cercius Pierre-Paul and the woman maiden name Jeancilia Pierre, both deceased. Accordingly we have drawn up and concluded this report of the proceedings which we have signed with the principals and the clerk. Thus signed: Philippe Emmanuel, Gerard Louis, Fedner Louis, Raoul Saint-Cyr, Magistrate, and Louis Edner Duverneau, clerk Verified: Judge of the District Court of the capital, East section, for the authentification of the signature of the above named clerk (seal signature of Judge) Certified Copy Collated Clerk Louis Edner Duverneau (seal signature of clerk) Left margin Certificate of Identity of Rose Carcon (also) known as Idora Pierre-Paul Born at Quartier Morin on December 1st 1905 of the legitimate union of husband Cersius Pierre-Paul and the woman, maiden name, Jeancilia Pierre, both deceased Bonny J. ,Saintelot, Notary Public My commission expires May 28 1987
